message: So here's the idea: there are a lot of really talented web devlopers and a lot of people who would like to be talented developers. Now, there plenty of great tutorials and books out there, but I think that there are many preople who would benefit from having someone to give them pointers. Things like giving assignments, reviewing code, and suggestions as to how to solve certain problems. So my question is how many people would use a service that match potential proteges with mentors?
I think you're on that already.
Most people dont have time to "mentor" people as you describe above. The most I am able to do is contribute back in open source projects, and im constantly falling behind :/
I came up with that idea a few years ago and gave up mainly because no one had time.
It's a great idea. Figure out a way to structure it so it's not time intensive for the mentor.
